summary: Build a lightweight flight radar app to track aircraft across the United States, with an interactive map (including a Schenectady, NY to Albany, NY view) and aircraft type categorization (general aviation, military, commercial).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Subtle radar screen background with grid, sweep glow, and noise texture in dark green/charcoal (radar-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Create an interactive flight-radar-style map view that displays aircraft tracks/positions across the continental United States, with pan/zoom and a radar-like visual overlay.
Add a map preset that quickly centers/zooms to the Schenectady, New York to Albany, New York corridor, while still allowing users to switch back to a full-US view.

Implement aircraft data ingestion to display live (or near-live) aircraft positions and track lines, sourced from a configurable REST endpoint. Store the configured endpoint and optional API key in the Motoko backend so it can be updated without redeploying the frontend.
Enable selecting/tapping an aircraft marker to view details including its category: general aviation, military, or commercial.
Add filtering controls to show/hide aircraft by category (general aviation, military, commercial) and reflect the filter state in the map results.

Define and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout) that fits a “radar console” aesthetic (avoid blue/purple as primary colors), and enforce it consistently across the UI.
Add generated static image assets required for the radar-console look, and render them from the frontend as static assets (do not serve images through the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Interactive map-based flight radar view to track aircraft across the United States
Aircraft type categorization and tap/select UI to view whether an aircraft is general aviation, military, or commercial
Map view presets/coverage for Schenectady, NY to Albany, NY corridor plus full US continent coverage
